title: Frank Racis
text:
Frank J. Racis (November 9, 1899 – August 19, 1982) was a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player from <a href="Shenandoah%2C%20Pennsylvania">Shenandoah, Pennsylvania</a>. He played during the early years of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> with the <a href="Pottsville%20Maroons">Pottsville Maroons</a>, <a href="Frankford%20Yellow%20Jackets">Frankford Yellow Jackets</a>, <a href="Boston%20Bulldogs%20%28NFL%29">Boston Bulldogs</a> and <a href="Providence%20Steam%20Roller">Providence Steam Roller</a>.
Career.
Straight out of high school, Racis made his professional debut with the Maroons in 1925. His career lasted 7 seasons. In 1925 Racis helped the Maroons win the NFL Championship, <a href="1925%20NFL%20Championship%20controversy">before it was stripped from the team due to a disputed rules violation</a>.
